name: muck
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
mud, dirt, or a sticky natural substance such as animal waste: There was green muck at the bottom of the boat. You're treading muck into the carpet with your dirty shoes! a pile of dog muck
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
dirtdirtHis coat was covered with dirt.filthThe building was covered in filth.grimeI had to scrub to remove the grime from the bath.grungeI need to clean all the grunge off my earrings.gunkI have to clean all this gunk from the engine.gungeUK There's a load of gunge clogging the pipes.
See more results »
UK something you consider very unpleasant or very low quality: I'm not eating that muck! The immigrants were treated like muck (= treated badly, as if they were not important).

Add to word list
wet, sticky dirt: It was hard to walk in the muck.
